availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Howe Richard (Bath Country, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p:
Bath County, Kentucky, merchant.
Bourbon County, Kentucky native. Married to [blank] in [blank]. Father to James Morrow Richard, Theodore Richard, and Mary C Richard.
Merchant in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 256.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Howe Richart (July 4, 1815- Jan 19, 1906)," Memorial #45169429,
https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45169429/joseph-howe-richart (accessed May 20, 2020).
